Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good value”
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: My family went to Disney on Easter weekend. Stayed at this hotel. The room is clean and the beds are very comfortable. Overall very good value for the price we paid, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Ncie Motel, some quality issues”
Reviews.Author: john461212
Reviews.Content: As usual, booked this in advance to get a good discount for my florida road trip. Very nice on the outside, quite a smart motel on the main strip in Kissemee, there are eating places in walking distance. Check-in was very quick, credit card and photo id, only took 5 minutes to get my key-card. Room(262) was very nice, clean and plenty of space, with 2 beds, fridge and microwave.The air-con was already on, so the room was nice and cool, nice touch I thought, as I come from colder clines. Bathroom was clean and everything as you would expect. There were a couple of problems, the power outlet by the fridge/microwave/coffee maker had a dead socket, so you had to keep swapping power cords over if you had anything to keep cool and wanted to heat something in the microwave, which for some reason the turntable drive was missing, so no rotary action. The sink plug device wasn't there, so difficult to have a shave, the water went down the plughole rather slowly, think it may have been partially blocked. The wifi was dog-slow, it would have been quicker to use smoke-signals.I give up trying to use it my room and compiled this report next morning at a McDonalds. Niggles like these should be picked up by the room service people, no excuse for things like this happening, it spoils a nice motel. As a motel it gets my vote but with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Fishbabe2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the week before Christmas 2011 and really enjoyed our stay. After spending the day at Disney World it was great to go back to the hotel and relax in the hot tub to ease our tired feet. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and had a dorm size refrigerator in the room. The continental breakfast was OK, but we would like something other than all carbs for breakfast. There are several nice restaurants close by and in walking distance. We will stay here again if we make it to Disney again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ruchi S
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews, rating and based on my past experiences with Howard Johnson chain.I was never disappointed, but this time it was terrible. I was travelling with my very young kids and parents and needed a kitchen suite and hence selected this hotel but as soon as we reached our room a cockroach welcomed us !!!!! Room looked so old and shabby, it had weird damp smell. It was just that I couldn't think of living there with young kids for a week , simply couldn't. The only thing that made me happy was, I was able to cancel my reservation and get my money back.!!!! Please avoid this hotel if you are vacationing with your kids or old parents :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget lodging”
Reviews.Author: carlabama
Reviews.Content: This is a budget motel but far exceeds the other motels in same area for similar price. There are lots of pluses: It was quiet (I had a poolside room in back that had view of pool and lake, front rooms may be louder, WIFI didn't pick up in back but did in front), clean (my room was updated with nice furniture and fridge, bathroom dated but clean), 2 hots tubs and HEATED pool that were well kept and a welcome relief after the parks, accommodating staff, safer due to U shaped building with parking in middle, I saw a couple of questionable characters but had no problems traveling by myself, it was mostly families doing the parks and enough of them coming and going so someone was usually coming in same time I was coming in at night. The convenience to the parks was priceless after experiencing the traffic on Int Dr and Buena Vista, generally 8 miles to any park but minimal traffic and 10-15 minute trip, this will become very important once you have experienced the traffic in other areas. Breakfast was typical continental, there is a grocery store, Subway sandwiches, Chinese plus other food across the street (a busy wide street but a traffic light is about 75 yards down then easy walk across). Wal Mart 1 mile. No resort or parking fees. I didn't use shuttle but saw the schedule, it seemed weird times to me, if you call they will probably give you the schedule, the public bus comes by there but you will waste precious time and it was mostly workers riding it from what i saw. I was going to stay my last night at a fancy place but after checking them out decided to remain at peaceful convenient HoJo instead. Warning, a half mile or so past HoJo toward Kissimmee gets very seedy/unsafe looking, the rooms are cheaper but it didn't look like tourists were staying in them, anywhere close to HoJo toward Disney looked safe. Kissimmee is generally the older budget motel area but for the convenience/efficiency in travel and eating was the best option for me.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location, will return”
Reviews.Author: sysy007
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at hojo.com at 25% discount for this motel. Our room is very clean, room size is about average. Swimming and hot tub are the back of hotel. It has a nice view of the lake from pool. Free breakfast includes orange, 2 type of cereal, bread, muffin. No waffle.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: mltubio
Reviews.Content: I paid 35 USD a night here, WIFI and breakfast was included. The hotel is very close to the Disneyworld parks, about 10 minutes by car (to Epcot). The hotel is very easy to find, and they also offer inexpensive weekly rates. My room had two queen beds, it was clean, and there was nothing wrong with it. I had room 137. Parking is also free and there is plenty of room. Breakfast was ok, even if the room is a bit small. It gets crowded around 9:30 pm. Breakfast is served from 7 to 10am. They offer kellogs corn flakes and special K, 2% and whole milk, orange and apple juice. Coffee, and tea. Bagels, toasts, jam and butter. And 3 types of muffins. The hotel is not luxurious, but it is a good place to stay if you don't want to spend a lot of money and if you want a clean and quiet place to sleep and have breakfast, close to the parks. There are plenty of restaurants close to the hotel. There's no cafeteria at the hotel, just vending machines, so if you are hungry at night, you need to get some food somewhere else. I have no complaints about this hotel, perhaps the staff could be nicer when you check in, that would be my only negative comment. Well, and I like harder matresses. Considering the price, this hotel exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: LKSPICE
Reviews.Content: I was a little cautious because we usually stay on Disney properties but with the economy and new home budgeting, I opted for a cheaper place to stay and I was pleasantly surprised. The price was great, the room was clean and the 3 nights we stayed the service was excellent. We were even able to have a room that was recently updated that included a microwave and refrigerator at no extra cost. The pool was very well kept. Hotel staff very efficient and friendly. The breakfast was your standard continental but enough to have something until the next meal. Our room was on the back of the property and it was very safe and no problems. I will stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option if you're on a Disney/Universal Studios trip!”
Reviews.Author: tapiocatundra
Reviews.Content: We were kinda scared with the reviews we find here but I gotta say I was really amazed by the great deal this hotel is! The building and the rooms are clearly from the 80's but they are very well maintained. We stayed in a double standard room but if you plan on cooking dinner o make some snacks for the day, I recommend you to book a room with a kitchen. The breakfast is a standard continental and is served in a very clean room with A/C and a TV. They have cereal, milk, bread, butter, jam, fruit, orange and apple juice and muffins. It opens from 7 am until 10 am. A great bonus of the hotel is its free shuttle which goes to Disney, Universal Studios and SeaWorld. Don't hesitate to stay here if you plan to be out all day in parks. It also has a great pool with quite a view if you rest one day, a communal microwave and a free ice-maker. Besides it has a Super Target across the street and an Olive Garden restaurant a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again!”
Reviews.Author: mikkichelle
Reviews.Content: Went with family, totaling 5. The room was clean, and well kept. Staff very helpful and eager to please. Hard to believe the space..everyone had enough room. And the view...AMAZING! Never thought we'd find such a great deal, and get more than we expected. Pool was nice and warm and clean. View of lake -beautiful. No complaints whatsoever. Will definitely be going HOJO Lake Front again! Way to go HOJO!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: hatched
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hojo from dec.23 till dec 29. 2010, i got sick right away 2 days later my eye blew up i went to the doctor and he said it was a bed bug bite i was scratching everywhere,staff wasnt helpful at that point at all the lady cleaned everyday but still it wasnt enough to stop the insects from attacking at night.

Reviews.Title: “If you're not too picky, great price”
Reviews.Author: HL1981
Reviews.Content: I went there from dec. 28th 2010 to jan. 4th 2011. The rooms are small and the bathroom is very small. Average cleanliness. We found a few small insects during the week. There is a laundry room available. The breakfast is served in a small and dirty room from 7h30 to 10ham. Not very well located. There are stores and restaurants at a walking distance but if you want to visit Orlando, you'll need a car. Overall, for the price, it's a good deal. But don't be too picky on quality. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value for money ... but thats about it !”
Reviews.Author: SurreySunshineFamily
Reviews.Content: We needed a place just to bed down for a 2 night stop in the area so we could visit the theme parks. We checked out Disney hotels, but as there was six of us (2 adults 4 children) it was way too expensive. So we decided to go cheap as all we were doing was sleeping there .. literally. We found this motel online and for $160 for 2 nights for a family of 6, we thought why not ? The gentleman on the reception was really nice and very helpful, he gave us maps and drew directions to the theme parks we were going to the next couple of days. I will be honest ... the place looked a bit seedy and the room we was given was a bit tired and really in need of modernisation and smelt a little musty .. it appeared to be clean .. we had no interest in using the kitchen facilities as we had already planned to eat out. The television worked fine so the kids were happy, but the bathrooms were a bit dated. The A/C worked ok and there was free wi-fi but it would have been nice to have a few more pillows, because we didnt sleep that well. There was a pool but we didnt use it. The bill was correct on checkout and the same man again was really nice and friendly to deal with and we got out of there On the whole .. this place is ok if you want somewhere cheap just to sleep when your visiting the theme parks, but if your looking for luxury and creature comforts while staying then I dont think this is for you ... but as they say .... " you get what you pay for"

Reviews.Title: “This was well worth the money and the staff was very professional and friendly”
Reviews.Author: KellieC111
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, very friendly. The property was neat and clean. The pool was very clean and warm enough for the kids. They have a continental breakfast that was ok, we wnated waffles though. The only thing I can say was wrong was the carpet in the room was kinda dirty and needs to be professionally cleaned, and they should look into getting small microwaves and mini fridges in each room. All in all, I was very happy with everything else at this hotel location, and I would recommend to others and stay there next year when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “would gladly stay again”
Reviews.Author: marial199
Reviews.Content: well check in was simple and easy ,we arrived after midnight and there was no hassle.all clerks from different times were very polite and friendly.Housekeeping was awesome,and never had to ask for anything.close to alot... HOJO should rethink on having the discount ticket guy there he is very annoying...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great breakfast, warm pool, little money.”
Reviews.Author: munchie11
Reviews.Content: This is in a great location for shopping and sightseeing. Backs on to Lake Cecil and has a fabulous heated pool and spa. Covered BBQ area, plenty of parking and serves a great inclusive breakfast. The room was comfortable and well equipped with a multi channel TV, although the carpet was a little grubby. Pleasant staff. Very reasonable deal for roomrate on the Internet. Have stayed here before and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Viviane18
Reviews.Content: First the good bit: The room was clean, as were the beds & the bathrooms. The beds were comfortable, the TVs worked well. The only staff I really dealt with was at the office & she was pleasant enough. We never used the pool. Parking is good. Value for money considering how cheap it was. Not so good: The so called 'games' room is like two machines in the laundry room. There is no Internet room. The kitchen floor was dirty, although the kitchen itself was OK. We could hear the laundry staff talking well into the evening, just outside our door. Later in the night a crowd of noisy people had gathered outside our back window and were there into the early hours. We did wonder how drug smoking etc... The worst for us: By accident I left my mobile phone behind. Upon realising this I phoned the hotel from Orlando Airport. But was told it was not in the room. Well I knew different. As customary I had to file a police report for my insurance. I did that & emailed the hotel telling them that plus the fact that my phone had GPS thus could be located. Well, guess what, suddenly my phone was found !! Miracle ?? It was eventually sent to me but damaged & tempered with. I would NEVER stay there again. To stay in a hjotel you need to trust the staff...

Reviews.Title: “When we arrived it felt like we had come home, we immediatley relaxed”
Reviews.Author: Technotoaster
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Our party of 5 have stayed at this hotel for our last three holidays to Florida. In fact the last time (2 years ago) we visited two other hotels to see if they offered anything better, yet we returned to this one. We had two rooms side by side, which the staff were able to accommodate, yet again. The hotel is ideally located. It is literally a five minute drive from most locations - (Walmarts, Petrol Stations, Food Outlets, Target, Disney, Old Town). The hotel has an army of workers who can be seen cleaning the rooms, the pool area, tending the brilliant gardens, and maintaining the hotel complex. The reception staff were more than helpful. They happily organised a taxi cab a few days in advance, and allowed me to use the telephone to dial Universal Studios Lost and Found. The rooms are more than adequate. Ours overlooked the pool, and the fantastic view over the Lake. The rooms were clean and thankfully had a fairly new looking A/C. In fact the rooms were all receiving new carpets on the day we left. Unlike the rooms in the other hotels, there was no evidence of mould or insects. The internet WiFi was a god send, and I was able to receive the signal on the old boat jetty. I cannot understand others who have left negative comments regarding the lack of pool cleaning or substandard breakfasts. We found that the pool was cleaned daily and the breakfasts saved us a small fortune to feed the 5 of us. I do however have a few suggestions for the hotel. I would recommend that the trees are pruned back, especially at the rear of the hotel. Our view was partially blocked by mature Palm trees. I would also love to see the hotel invest in upgrading the BBQ building and the boat jetty, both of which are in danger of being blown over in the next hurricane. A big well done, and thank you to all the staff who helped make our holiday yet another one to remember. And we def look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience of our holidays!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RGSOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We found the exterior of the hotel quite appealing and the sign said rooms $ 39.95. The clerk at the front counter should have tipped us off but being tired we took a room. I asked to go back from the road and ended up having to carry luggage around to the back of the hotel. The pool looked good but I didn't use it. The wharf was a disaster waiting to happen and needs to be tore down before some kids get hurt. Then we checked out the room. What a disaster this was. The carpet was dirty and loose. the bathroom looked like it seem soap months before we arrived. The bed sheets smelled as if they had been used before and were not fresh. Flordia is well known for the many snakes and they could come visit anytime because there was about a 1 - 11/2 gap at the bottom of the door. The curtains looked like they were washed and put up without ironing. We seen different bugs thruout the room and the only thing that my wife was looking forward to was check-out. The sign at the front advertised the cost of a room at $39.95. Our bill came to 54.19 before taxes and when I asked why I was told because we wanted a room in the back unit. Seems I was making her work and she didn't want to and had the attitude that I owe her and not that she was providing a service to us. We were charged for a safe in the room that we didn't ask for or use. Would I recommend this hotel to anyone. Not in your life, I would tell you to go to HOJO at the Tropical Palms for $29.95 a night and clean rooms and pleaseant service. They do not advertise one price and charge you another. It is a longer drive but you can bet you will get a clean room and better service.

Reviews.Title: “IDK Why This Hotel Gets Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: cwbys4evr
Reviews.Content: I can only assume they have rennovated, because I am currently staying in a two room suite and it is just fine. In fact, it's more than I would expect because it has a full kitchen, complete with stove/oven, refrigerator, and dishwasher. Try getting that elsewhere, you'd be charged an arm and a leg, maybe two legs. The room is clean and affordable. The lobby is nice. The check in clerk was very friendly and informative. The high speed internet is good. I thought it was slow at first then I realized that after the automatic login it will take you to a blank page that looks like it's something loading up. Ignore it and type in whatever address you want. The pool is closed for rennovations but you can go to one of two other hotels these people own and swim in their pools if you want. We are opting for Aquatica instead. We're not on vacation for a hotel pool anyway, plus we have passes to the Busch Gardens owned theme parks. There are no traces of bugs or anything else that other people have mentioned. Believe me, I read the reviews and went over this place with a critical eye when we checked in, and found everything to my satisfaction. For those who complained about the continental breakfast, what the heck did you expect ? They had pastries, cereal, milk, juice, muffins, toast, english muffins - were you expecting steak and eggs ???????? Some people are too picky I guess. The property is also conveniently located to everything in the Orlando/Kissimmee area and just a short jaunt from Interstate 4. This hotel is a great deal and we plan on staying here next year too.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kitty9898
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the HoJo July 24th-30th. It is in close proximity to Disney (I think about 5 miles)by car. There is a shuttle bus service to Disney etc. There is free WiFi if you bring your own. The pool looked decent, although I did not go in. The room is old and outdated, the carpet is worn. The bathroom was clean. The lobby smelled like soemthing died in it. I think the price is right- everything else is so expensive in Orlando, if you can put up with it- go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Never go !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aktko7017
Reviews.Content: The only good thing is the breakfast,a lot of roaches allover the places.stay away from this dirty motel. it has a very dirty smell. the carpet is ugly and smells like garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experiance Ever”
Reviews.Author: dholsom
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite based on the company website. When we got there it seemed ok from the entrance, but then we got to the room. My wife almost cried. The place was ,in a word, dirty. The carpet was sticky. The bedroom door (going outside) would not deadbolt. The bathrooms were moldy. The paint was chipping. My wife would not let the kids walk on the carpet with bare feet. I know that people can exagerate, but this was not the case. It was late, so we had little choice. The next night after we hit disney, I left with the sole intention of finding another place to stay. I did. Unless they did some serious renovation (short of a bulldozer) you should avoid this place like the plague. I know ironic use of the word plague if you had seen the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “OK, except for the Extra Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: travelbob1
Reviews.Content: There is a $4.50 "resort fee" because of the outdoor swimming pool, whether you use it or not in February on a cool, rainy day?? The room is simple with an ironing board, iron and hair dryer. The floor in around the vanity always had a sticky feel, but was clean. The sink and tub drains all worked slowly. Housekeeping was adequate. The internet computers in the lobby and wi-fi was included, but very slow. For a place to stay and run around to all the sites it is OK for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but be aware!”
Reviews.Author: JimCDenton
Reviews.Content: This location is an older hotel that has been painted to make it appear nicer than what it is. The pool and hot tub are nice, but the floors of both are chipping away so there is sandy concrete under your feet all the time. The lake view is there but don't make the mistake of walking down to the lake expecting a nice clean shore. There is trash and debris in the water and the dock that extends over the water is rotted and ready to give way. The playground for the children consists of one old worn and rusted swing set. However, the price was right and the location central to the various attractions. Also, the "continental breakfast" is very limited - muffins, toast, english muffins, and a couple of cereals only. Worse yet, the breakfast is served in a converted hotel room that is cramped and just too small for the many people staying here (at least it was during the Christmas week rush).

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: soulprovider915
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to FL for about 3 years. My opinion of the hotel is going to be neutral. I stay here because I know what to expect. The first room I went to had a bad wet odor to it. They immediately gave me a room with microwave and refrigerator. It had the same smell but not nearly as bad. I figured the humidity had something to do with it or the fact that they actually cleaned the rugs with water. It was a very quiet stay. The pool area is great. I feel that the hotel is safe. Maintenance is very responsive. Breakfast is ok as well. Again the staff is great and friendly. The manager and some of the front desk people are still the same from the first time I went there years ago. That tells me a lot. Shopping is very close! In closing I'll say this. Although the hotel is old and starting to show some wear, it is by no means dilapidated like some people say on this site. I will stay there again next year in May or so.

Reviews.Title: “good enough for me”
Reviews.Author: mlein
Reviews.Content: I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The staff was very friendly and quick to respond to our request for a roll-away. Nice pool area with views of the lake in a quieter part of Kissimmee. The room was clean if somewhat worn and more than sufficient for our stay. The outerdoor and bathroom door could have used a lick of paint. The only real complaint that we had was the sugary breakfast which I believe was expanded to include more than just danish and donuts the day after we left.

Reviews.Title: “Worst than Expected”
Reviews.Author: us2briggs
Reviews.Content: The room carpet was dirty and old. The shower had names carved in the tiles.The bathroom lightbulb had a short. The closest ice machine was broken. The continental breakfast was prepackaged stuff like you would find in a convenience store. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole”
Reviews.Author: JFW123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this horrible place in December, 2004. I am going back to Florida soon and while researching area hotels, I saw this HoJo location on this web site and I began to feel sick. The "suite" we booked was not available, as our reservation was mishandled. The room we were given was run-down, dirty, and looked very cheap. We were later moved to a suite when one became available, and it was horrible. The oven was hard to operate, there was no cookware in the cabinet (I had to go to the supermarket and buy some), and we found out the ticket outlet next door was robbed while we were there. The continental breakfast was a tray of donuts. We will definitely stay at Disney next time. You get what you pay for. This would barely qualify as a welfare motel.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap motel.”
Reviews.Author: Daubs2
Reviews.Content: Just to Clarify we stayed at the Howard Johson Express Inn & Suites Lakefront Park 4836 W. Irlo Bronson Hwy. (AKA: US-192). I have to say for $50 a night it wasn’t bad. The carpet was clean the bathroom was clean and house keeping did a good job. The pictures on HOJO's web site are a little off. The color scheme of the building's exterior was in the process of being changed while we were there. We primarily needed a place to lay our head while visiting Epcot and MGM-Studios. We chose the Lakefront Park hotel because it said they had a continental breakfast and free shuttle to the parks. Well after reading a prior post about the shuttle service leaving the park early and being the last stop on the route we chose to drive the rental car to the parks and pay $9 for parking. All you have to do is take US-192 west and you end up right at Disney’s front gate. It was well worth it to drive since we got the see Epcot's excellent nightly fireworks. The continental breakfast was really kind of a joke. All they had during the week was pre-packaged baked goods (i.e. crumb cakes, pound cake, ciniman rolls, think how twinkes are packaged and you've got the picture). On Saturday they did have doughnuts from a bakery, which was nice. Also available was coffee and orange juice from a cafeteria-style machine. On an up note there are plenty of places to catch a quick breakfast like McDonald's, Burger King, or IHOP on your way to the park. There are also quite a few restaurants like Applebee’s right on US-192. The location was pretty good in general. From the HOJO, you can take US-535 (Vineland Rd.), which is the first stop light on US-192 west to the right, and make your way to Down Town Disney. At Down Town Disney there are plenty of things to see and places to eat. Some of the attractions include the house of blues and Cirque Du Soleil just to name a few and parking is free. Also off of US-535 you can take US-536 (World center drive) to the right and hit International drive that also has an array of things to see. If you like cars and racing I'd highly suggest Race Rock Cafe on International drive. You can also make your way to Universal/ Universal City Walk via International Drive by taking Universal Dr. Be waned though whether you're just going to see City Walk or Universal theme parks it still cost's $10 for parking either way. If you are looking at finding a different inexpensive place to stay you may want to research The Palms Suites Lakeside in Kissimmee it’s just a little ways down from the Lake Front Park HOJO. At the Palms all units have an equipped kitchen, microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker that would be nice if you wanted to make your own breakfast. There is a Target Store right across the street and a Super Wal-mart right on US-535 for picking up breakfast foods and things that might have been left at home. All in all, if you're looking for a clean inexpensive place to sleep while visiting Disney then the Lake Front Park Howard Johnson in Kissimmee will do fine. BTW: if your are an NRA member you can get a discount to stay at all Howard Johnson's and other hotels @ ----

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Express Inn & Suites Lake Front Park
HotelInfo.Address: 4836 W Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway, SR535 and US Hwy 192, Kissimmee, FL 34746
